captions.text: Come come come...
Come guys...
A lion without his bite, is not really a lion.

It’s really important for a lion to have
a full set of teeth that are usable.

Aslan is a a nine-year-old 
white male lion,
he's always had a bit of a tricky character.

but since he broke his canines i
t’s got a lot worse.
He’s become more aloof,
he’s become more agitated, more aggressive,
he isolates himself from the pride,
and… yeah, he’s just a different cat.
He holds a special place in my heart, because
when he was very young he got bitten by his father,
just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

I couldn’t imagine anything better 
than having a white lion
and it was quite an incredible thing to see

this really pure white ball of fluff 
amongst all these brown lions.

The reason why I can run around with
these lions and be accepted amongst them
is because I have a relationship with them.

I never for one moment think that
they are domesticated animals.
I'm always mesmerized. I'm always in awe.

You can’t look at a lion and go “that
is how a lion behaves.” It's wrong.

27 lions at the sanctuary, all of them behave
very differently.

My hopes for the operation are that Aslan
wakes up a new cat.

It’s not easy is not putting him under a
stich’em up or a simple procedure,

this is a long procedure, it could take as
long as 4 hours.

You know having a lion under for that period
of time…
that can be a worry.
It is going to be fine...
Come on boy…

When Fixodent came along and offered to help
out
it was absolutely perfect timing.

It really does have that ability
to give him his bite back.

I think it’s gonna be well worth it 
and turn out well.
It’s a big day, hey.

What makes this kind of procedure 
quite unique here

is that we have brought all our equipment
out and we’re going to do it on site.

We're going to do it at the same level as
it would be done in any big hospital,
and I think we’ve done that quite successfully.
Gently roll him...
You are going to do the root canal first?

Yeah this bottom one, and that one so then
there’s no blood…

Dental pain, and most people can associate
with it, is a chronic pain.

It's not an acute pain that just drives you
nuts now, it’s a debilitating pain,

it’s a pain that you don't want to do things,
you're just thinking of this tooth the whole time.
Hey my boy, you’re gonna be good.
Yeah, that’s just rotten.
This is the last piece.
It's the tip of the root, and it's open.

Suddendly he is gonna wake up and in a few days 
he is not going to have these pain sensations anymore.

and I think is going to be a much happier
lion.

The operation was a lot more involved
than I expected.
It was just short of 6 hours.

There were more teeth that needed work on. 
I thought it was just 2, but we actually ended up working on 4.
He's a real tough character, to endure that.
Now, with hopefully no pain in the mouth and

and the ability to bite nicely, 
He's not gonna feel so insecure.

So it's almost at the point where 
I think he's ready to be reintroduced back to his friends.

It’s been a while since I could give you
a tickle under the chin like that, hey?

Most people would imagine the introduction 
of a lion who has been away

from his pride for a while, to be this whole
romantic hugs and kisses thing.
But sometimes with lions it isn't like that.
Hey look who is here!
I think the other lions were happy to see him back.

Within a short period of time
they were all lying together,

and licking each other, 
and sleeping amongst each other.
We're gonna have a happy pride.
The king is back.

Je vous remercie pour vos commentaires. Sincèrement. La cause animale me 
touche parce-que, dans la misère du monde, on oublie trop souvent la 
souffrance des animaux.
Concernant ces lions, ils font partie d'une réserve et je pense qu'ils 
n'ont pas besoin de chasser pour se nourrir. N'oublions pas que l'homme et 
les braconniers sont les plus grands et cruels prédateurs.
Merci +Louise-Anne Poulin +Ninaïe Bop +Joséphine Marie +Gerard Lefebvre . 
Je vous souhaite une bonne nuit. A bientôt.

comments.text:
IL est dit qu'un lion qui ne peut pas mordre ne peut pas vivre, ect... 
ASLAN,  un lion qui a perdu une canine et  plusieurs dents va être opéré, 
(une opération qui a duré un peu moins que 6 heures) et il en ressort pas 
du tout mal en point. En très peu de temps, il s'allongeait à nouveau à 
côté de ses congénères. J'adore ce genre d'histoires: sauver des animaux, 
 de toutes sortes de situations désastreuses. Un vrai bonheur !﻿

comments.text:
Aslan, es un león blanco de Sudáfrica que perdió dos de sus caninos, un 
tipo de lesión que alteró profundamente su vida. 
Una empresa de adhesivos para ‪#‎dentaduras‬ le pagó los ‪#‎implantes‬ 
dentales , ya que se había aislado de su manada al perder los caninos, lo 
que le impedía cazar y alimentarse.

A raíz de ello, se quiere crear un movimiento en solidaridad con aquellas 
personas que como Aslan sufren la pérdida de piezas ‪#‎dentales‬ con el 
estrés físico y emocional que eso conlleva.﻿
comments.author: Centro Europeo de Implantología Oral

comments.text:
Спасение льва

Стоматологическая компания Fixodent в сотрудничестве с Kukident и 
Blend-a-dent провели уникальную операцию. Поводом для ее проведения стал 
совершенно особенный случай: в одном из заповедников в Африке произошел 
несчастный случай с белым львом, в результате которого тот лишился клыка и 
повредил часть других зубов. Добрые люди из Fixodent предложили свою 
помощь, на что смотрители с радостью согласились. По итогу 6-часовой 
операции лев по имени Аслан избавился от гнилых обломков клыка, а заодно и 
от боли, которая его мучала и мешала нормально питаться. В конце ролика 
Fixodent говорят, что это то, чем они занимаются каждый день – помогают 
людям. Трогательная история со счастливым финалом растопила сердца зрителей.
﻿
